metachat.pl.plot_communication_flowÔÉÅ

metachat.pl.plot_communication_flow(adata, database_name=None, metabolite_name=None, metapathway_name=None, customerlist_name=None, plot_method='cell', background='summary', background_legend=False, library_id=None, group_name=None, summary='sender', cmap='coolwarm', group_cmap=None, pos_idx=array([0, 1]), ndsize=1, scale=1.0, normalize_summary_quantile=0.995, normalize_v=False, normalize_v_quantile=0.95, arrow_color='#000000', grid_density=1.0, grid_knn=None, grid_scale=1.0, grid_thresh=1.0, grid_width=0.005, stream_density=1.0, stream_linewidth=1, stream_cutoff_perc=5, title=None, plot_savepath=None, ax=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function for plotting spatial metabolic cell flow.

The metabolic cell communication should have been computed by the function mc.tl.metabolic_communication(). The metabolic cell communication for some specific metabolite, metabolic pathway and customerlist should have been summarized by the function mc.tl.summary_communication(). The metabolic cell communication flow should have been computed by the function mc.tl.communication_flow().

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) ‚Äì The data matrix of shape n_obs √ó n_var. Rows correspond to cells or positions and columns to genes.

  • database_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Name of the Metabolite-Sensor interaction database.

  • metabolite_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Name of a specific metabolite to detect response genes. For example, metabolite_name = ‚ÄòHMDB0000148‚Äô.

  • metapathway_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Name of a specific metabolic pathways to detect response genes. For example, metabolite_name = ‚ÄòAlanine, aspartate and glutamate metabolism‚Äô.

  • customerlist_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Name of a specific customerlist to detect response genes. For example, customerlist_name = ‚ÄòCustomerA‚Äô.

  • plot_method (str) ‚Äì ‚Äòcell‚Äô plot vectors on individual cells. ‚Äògrid‚Äô plot interpolated vectors on regular grids. ‚Äòstream‚Äô streamline plot.

  • background (str) ‚Äì ‚Äòsummary‚Äô: scatter plot with color representing total sent or received signal. ‚Äòimage‚Äô: the image in Visium data. ‚Äògroup‚Äô: scatter plot with color representing cell groups.

  • background_legend (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include the background legend when background is set to summary or group.

  • library_id (Optional[str]) ‚Äì library_id to specify image when background is set to ‚Äòimage‚Äô.

  • group_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì The key for cell group annotation. Needed if background is set to group. For example, if group_name=='leiden', the group annotation should be available in .obs['leiden'].

  • summary (str) ‚Äì If background is set to ‚Äòsummary‚Äô, the numerical value to plot for background. ‚Äòsender‚Äô: node color represents sender weight. ‚Äòreceiver‚Äô: node color represents receiver weight.

  • cmap (str) ‚Äì matplotlib colormap name for node summary if numerical (background set to ‚Äòsummary‚Äô), e.g., ‚Äòcoolwarm‚Äô. plotly colormap name for node color if summary is (background set to ‚Äògroup‚Äô). e.g., ‚ÄòAlphabet‚Äô.

  • group_cmap (Optional[dict]) ‚Äì A dictionary that maps group names to colors when setting background to ‚Äògroup‚Äô. If given, cmap will be ignored.

  • pos_idx (ndarray) ‚Äì The coordinates to use for plotting (2D plot).

  • ndsize (float) ‚Äì The node size of the spots.

  • scale (float) ‚Äì The scale parameter passed to the matplotlib quiver function matplotlib.pyplot.quiver() for vector field plots. The smaller the value, the longer the arrows.

  • normalize_summary_quantile (float) ‚Äì If background is set to ‚Äòsummary‚Äô, the numerical value greater than a quantile will be the same as that quantile.

  • normalize_v (bool) ‚Äì Whether the normalize the vector field to uniform lengths to highlight the directions without showing magnitudes.

  • normalize_v_quantile (float) ‚Äì The vector length quantile to use to normalize the vector field.

  • arrow_color (str) ‚Äì The color of the arrows.

  • grid_density (float) ‚Äì The density of grid if plot_method=='grid'.

  • grid_knn (Optional[int]) ‚Äì If plot_method=='grid', the number of nearest neighbors to interpolate the signaling directions from spots to grid points.

  • grid_scale (float) ‚Äì The scale parameter (relative to grid size) for the kernel function of mapping directions of spots to grid points.

  • grid_thresh (float) ‚Äì The threshold of interpolation weights determining whether to include a grid point. A smaller value gives a tighter cover of the tissue by the grid points.

  • grid_width (float) ‚Äì The value passed to the width parameter of the function matplotlib.pyplot.quiver() when plot_method=='grid'.

  • stream_density (float) ‚Äì The density of stream lines passed to the density parameter of the function matplotlib.pyplot.streamplot() when plot_method=='stream'.

  • stream_linewidth (float) ‚Äì The width of stream lines passed to the linewidth parameter of the function matplotlib.pyplot.streamplot() when plot_method=='stream'.

  • stream_cutoff_perc (float) ‚Äì The quantile cutoff to ignore the weak vectors. Default to 5 that the vectors shorter than the 5% quantile will not be plotted.

  • title (Optional[str]) ‚Äì The title of diagram.

  • plot_savepath (Optional[str]) ‚Äì If given, save to the plot_savepath. For example ‚Äòmcc_flow.pdf‚Äô.

  • ax (Optional[Axes]) ‚Äì An existing matplotlib ax (matplotlib.axis.Axis).

Returns:

ax ‚Äì The matplotlib ax object of the plot.

Return type:

matplotlib.axis.Axis
